metadata.Title: CVE-2020-2760 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.29 and prior and8.0.19 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privilegedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLServer. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorizedability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) ofMySQL Server as well as unauthorized update, insert or delete access tosome of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 5.5 (Integrityand Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libmariadbclient18 - 1:10.1.47-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libmariadbd18 - 1:10.1.47-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mariadb-10.1 package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:10.1.47-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
